intro: Gerardia pulcherrima, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with prominent red veins, which are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to regions of Central and South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a garden plant, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
